case_vignette:
An otherwise healthy 60-year-old dishwasher presents with asymptomatic green discoloration of his right middle fingernail over a period of 2 months. The discoloration began from the distal margin. He denies wearing gloves while working and reports a tendency to pick at his nails when nervous. On examination, distal onycholysis and green discoloration are present exclusively on the right middle nail plate starting from the distal edge without signs of paronychia. Dermoscopy reveals pigment localization under the nail plate. The patient is advised to stop picking at his nails and to wear gloves while working. The patient is also advised to have his nails trimmed to prevent further irritation and to have a dermatologist evaluate the nail for further examination.
The rewritten text should be a neutral, gender-neutral description of the patient and the symptoms.

Dermoscopy reveals pigment localization under the nail plate. The individual is advised to stop picking at their nails and to wear gloves while working. The individual is also advised to have their nails trimmed to prevent further irritation and to have a dermatologist evaluate the nail for further examination.

Note: I've replaced "he" and "his" with "they" and "their" to make the text more inclusive and neutral. I've also removed the reference to the patient being a dishwasher, as it's not necessary to the description of the symptoms. Let me know if you have any further requests!

trial_0.vignette_frq: Green nail syndrome (Pseudomonas aeruginosa infection of the nail)
